niagara.data_manager
Class DBThread

java.lang.Object
  niagara.optimizer.colombia.Op
      niagara.optimizer.colombia.PhysicalOp
          niagara.data_manager.SourceThread
              niagara.data_manager.DBThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Initializable, Instrumentable, Schedulable, SchemaProducer, SerializableToXML
public class DBThread
extends SourceThread

DBThread provides a SourceThread compatible interface to fetch data from a rdbms via jdbc

findLocalCost

public Cost findLocalCost(ICatalog catalog,
                          LogicalProperty[] InputLogProp)
Description copied from class: PhysicalOp
Local cost of the operator, including output but not input costs. Thus we compute output costs only once, and get input costs from (as part of) the input operators' cost

Specified by:
findLocalCost in class PhysicalOp
See Also:
niagara.optimizer.colombia.PhysicalOp#FindLocalCost(ICatalog, LogicalProperty, LogicalProperty[])

hashCode

Specified by:

See Also:
Object.hashCode()

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
Description copied from class: Op
We require logical and physical operators to redefine equals and hashCode, in the context of the optimizer. We don't worry too much about data structures that are used afterwards in query execution. If there is any way that we can produce a duplicate of an operator using optimizer transformations (e.g. in joins), equals() MUST not be plain pointer equality. The amount of things we must check in equals() depends (as in copy()) on what the optimizer transformations can do. x.equals(x) and x.copy().equals(x) should always be true. If we change equals() we must also change hashCode() so that x.equals(y) => x.hashCode() == y.hashCode() remains true.

Specified by:
equals in class Op
See Also:
Object.equals(Object)
